action.content:
Things are in different places, but the questioner does not know about it yet. Here is the situation:

WHAT: Things at places
LEFT: paintbrush
RIGHT: neon
TOP: boron
BOTTOM: screws
CENTER: plate
NORTHWEST: saucepan
NORTHEAST: lipstick
SOUTHWEST: argon
SOUTHEAST: lyre
HERE: rake
THERE: tank top
NOWHERE: shirt
EVERYWHERE: eagle
INSIDE: pansy
OUTSIDE: lizard

Questions from the questioner will start with QUESTIONER. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <some text>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <some text>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
Begin probing
ME:  Does the questioner know what is on your left? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that I have a paintbrush on my left.

ME:  Is the questioner asking if I have a paintbrush on my left? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner is asking if I have a paintbrush on my left.

ME:  Is the questioner asking if the paintbrush is a real object or just a

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the paintbrush is on my left.

ASIDE: Yes, the neon is on my right.

ME: You're welcome. That's all for now.

ASIDE: You're welcome
NA

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the paintbrush is on my left.

ME: Now, please tell me what is on your right. Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that the neon is on my right.

ME: Great! Now, please tell me what is on your top. Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ME: Is the questioner aware of what is on your right? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: Yes, the questioner knows that I have a neon on my right.
